casebody.data:
STATE of Missouri, Respondent,
v.
Forrest E. HARRIS, Appellant. ED 106114 Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District, DIVISION FIVE. Filed: October 2, 2018
Motions for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied November 5, 2018 Nancy A. McKerrow, 1400 Forum Blvd., Suite 7, Box 203, Columbia, MO 65203, for appellant. Garrick Aplin, Assistant Attorney General, P.O. Box 899, Jefferson City, MO 65102-0899, for respondent. Before Lisa P. Page, C.J., Colleen Dolan, J., and Ted House, Sp. J.

ORDER

PER CURIAM.

Forrest E. Harris ("Harris") appeals the trial court's judgment entered upon a jury verdict convicting him of one count of first-degree assault pursuant to Section 565.050 RSMo (2016), 1 armed criminal action, Section 571.015, unlawful use of a weapon, Section 571.030, and unlawful possession of a firearm, Section 571.070. We affirm.

We have reviewed the briefs of the parties and the record on appeal and find no error of law. No jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order.

The judgment is affirmed pursuant to Rule 30.25(b).

All further statutory references are to RSMo (2016).
